sense.def:
To build a structure
pomeni nekaj narediti iz sestavnih delov.

seg.quote: John had built a house facing the river.

sense.def:
To build an organization or a society
pomeni postopoma oblikovati organizacijo ali družbo.

seg.quote: They struggled to build a more democratic society.

sense.def:
One's build
je oblika človekovega telesa, ki mu jo dajo kosti in mišice.

seg.quote: She was in her early thirties, with a lean, athletic build.

sense.def:
To build something into a wall or object
pomeni nekaj narediti tako, da tisto postane del zidu ali predmeta ali pa je v njegovi notranjosti.

seg.quote: There was a cupboard built into the whitewashed wall.

sense.def:
To build something into a policy, system, or product
pomeni poskrbeti, da nekaj postane del politike, sistema ali izdelka.

seg.quote: ...the inequalities built into our system of financing.

sense.def:
To build an organization, system, or product on something
pomeni, da je neka organizacija, sistem ali izdelek postavljen na neko podlago.

seg.quote: ...the principles on which these organizations are built.

sense.def:
To build on
ali
to build upon the success of something
pomeni izkoristiti uspeh nečesa za nadaljnje napredovanje.

seg.quote: We must try to build on the success of these growth industries.

sense.def:
Če količina nečesa
builds up
ali če človek
builds it up
, postopoma narašča, ker jo dodajamo že obstoječi.

seg.quote: Mud builds up in the lake.
We're trying to build up a collection of herbs and spices.

sense.def:
To build up someone's trust or confidence
pomeni postopoma doseči, da postane nekdo bolj zaupljiv ali lahkoveren.

To build someone up
pomeni povzročiti, da nekdo po bolezni znova pridobi prejšnjo težo.
